result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Bond on hand will be applied towards costs.
Must submit DNA sample.  AODA and comply.  May report to probation by Noon on 3-11-16.

timeConds.notes: w/Huber.  Jail start is to be determined by agent, must start within the first 4 months of probation.  Electronic Monitoring is approved by Court.

records.addlTxt: and Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty. Dolch
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Daniel Moore in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct.1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2 & 3 Dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  30 days jail, with Huber.  Jail start is to be determined by agent, must be within the first 4 months of probation.  2 days jail credit.  Must submit DNA sample.  Bond to be applied towards costs.  Defendant is eligible for electronic monitoring.  On 15TR2803 Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to pay $811.50 fines and costs.  6 month DL revocation.  AODA and comply.  60 days to pay on the TR case.  15TR1117 is dismissed.  May report to probation by noon on 3-11-16.
